intro: Heracleum sphondylium subsp. artvinense, commonly known as the Artvin cowparsnip, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of northeastern Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring a tall, branched inflorescence with small white to greenish flowers. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp, typical of the genus Heracleum. This subspecies is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
